intro: Fagara cuspidata, commonly known as the prickly sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
